TopicTitle: Please help me understand Air Intakes and Air as a resource...

Articles.Content:
I have read that you need .07 air for each turbojet. This seems to hold true(ish) for single jet craft, though I have observed lack of flameout down to about .06. But in multi-jet aircraft I can stay full-throttle down to .02-.03 sometimes. WTF?

Edited October 26, 2013 by g00bd0g

That number in the resources panel isn't reliable; right-click on the intake instead.

The way things work is that every round, every part is processed. When an intake is processed, it sets its tank of air to have the right amount of air given the conditions. When an engine is processed, it burns air from the intakes. So in a physics frame, you might get:

1. Engine burns air.

2. Intake fills up.

3. Resources tab redraws; intake has a lot of air in it.

Or you might get:

1. Intake fills up.

2. Engine burns air.

3. Resources tab redraws; intake has very little air in it.

Add more engines and intakes, and you see that the number is basically useless.
